definition: to work on one's own/to work single-handed/individual farming
surname Shan
bill/list/form/single/only/sole/odd number/CL:個|个[ge4]
dry/clean/in vain/dried food/foster/adoptive/to ignore
variant of 乾|干[gan1]
old variant of 乾|干[gan1]
to concern/to interfere/shield/stem
surname Gan
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Programming has been essentially a solitary profession for the last five decades.
sentences.chinese: 在过去五十年里，编程基本上是一种单干的职业。

sentences.english: Your Week Ahead: When you work as part of a team, you can accomplish much more than you might ever achieve on your own.
sentences.chinese: 与团队协作会比你独自单干所取得的成绩要大得多。

sentences.english: Only when doing things alone can he show his paces.
sentences.chinese: 只有单干的时候他才能显露出自己的真本事。

sentences.english: Having to work alone, he wanted all his time for his research.
sentences.chinese: 他必须单干，所以他想把他的全部时间投入研究工作。

sentences.english: Most farms were one- family businesses.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农场是独户单干。

sentences.english: Alone, most of the electronic bits are wimpy and would die of nonuse .
sentences.chinese: 单干，多数电子簇就会失去作用，并因此而死亡。

sentences.english: If you have the dream of being self-employed, get started when you have the greatest opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 如果你梦想自己单干，那么当你有好机会时就开始吧。

sentences.english: Congress adjourns in 3 weeks, we can't do this alone.
sentences.chinese: 距国会开会只有3个星期，我们不能单干。

sentences.english: Mr. Wu told us that all these years he was the only one working in the store.
sentences.chinese: 吴先生告诉我们这些年他一直都是单干。

sentences.english: The lateral segment mey be single trunk or double trunks.
sentences.chinese: 外侧段有单干型和双干型。

sentences.english: Which would you prefer, working with others or alone?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意和别人一起共事还是单干？

definition: to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to fight alone (idiom)
to act jointly/to form a partnership
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
to seize power/to conquer the world/to establish and expand a business/to carve out a career for oneself
to take on a piece of work/to pick up some freelance work/(of a taxi driver) to pick up a fare
solitary hero/maverick
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
to start a clique/to form a faction
